texts.value: Binds with high affinity to muscular nicotinic acetylcholine receptors (nAChRs) (tested on Torpedo marmorata, Kd=0.07 nM), and with low affinity to neuronal alpha-7/CHRNA7 nAChRs (tested on chimeric alpha-7/CHRNA7, Kd=22 uM) and inhibit acetylcholine from binding to the receptor, thereby impairing neuromuscular transmission (PubMed:7721859). Produces peripheral paralysis by blocking neuromuscular transmission at the postsynaptic site
Belongs to the snake three-finger toxin family. Short-chain subfamily. Type I alpha-neurotoxin sub-subfamily

citation.title: Sequence analysis of a cDNA encoding a erabutoxin b from the sea-snake Laticauda semifasciata.
Classification of sea snakes in genus Laticauda by nucleotide sequences encoding short chain neurotoxins.
Molecular evolution and diversification of snake toxin genes, revealed by analysis of intron sequences.
The amino acid sequences of erabutoxins, neurotoxic proteins of sea-snake (Laticauda semifasciata) venom.
Correction of partial amino acid sequence of erabutoxins.
Genetic engineering of snake toxins. The functional site of Erabutoxin a, as delineated by site-directed mutagenesis, includes variant residues.
Only snake curaremimetic toxins with a fifth disulfide bond have high affinity for the neuronal alpha7 nicotinic receptor.
The crystal structure of a post-synaptic neurotoxin from sea snake at 2.2-A resolution.
Structure and function of snake venom curarimimetic neurotoxins.
Molecular conformation of erabutoxin b; atomic coordinates at 2.5-A resolution.
Erabutoxin b. Structure/function relationships following initial protein refinement at 0.140-nm resolution.
Structure determination of a dimeric form of erabutoxin-b, crystallized from a thiocyanate solution.
Tertiary structure of erabutoxin b in aqueous solution as elucidated by two-dimensional nuclear magnetic resonance.
